headline: Healthy Chicken Salad
description: This healthy chicken salad recipe made with Greek yogurt and cottage cheese instead of mayonnaise is creamy and delicious and packed with protein.

video.description: This chicken salad is fresh and healthy!
video.name: Healthy Chicken Salad

name: Healthy Chicken Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 (6 ounce) container fat-free Greek yogurt (such as Fage®)
0.25 cup sweetened dried cranberries (such as Craisins®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Stir Greek yogurt, cottage cheese, celery, apple, cranberries, onion, pecans, and Dijon mustard in a bowl until well combined.
Mix in chicken. Season with salt and pepper.

review.reviewBody: I love the Greek yogurt, cottage cheese, mustard as the sauce for this salad. Rather than double the chicken as others suggested to better equal the amount of sauce, I doubled the celery/apple / Craisins/ onion / walnuts and loved it. Sell your stock in Mircle Whip as this is my new salad dressing. Thanks Yoly.
Best chicken salad ever

I loved it. The Greek yogurt n cottage cheese was different n actually a good substitute for mayonnaise. I did sprinkle parmesan cheese, seasoning salt n black pepper. Oh, I added a little sweet chili sauce which made it just great for a sandwich. It was delicious!
Yogurt made it sour tasting. It was ok, but I will not make again.
I thought this chicken salad was delicious. Being on weight watchers , I'm always looking for low point recipes, and this is just that. I will continue to make this chicken salad.

This recipe is absolutely fantastic. I just made it for the first time and i loved it. I kept it as written except for omitting the celery and cranberries. Otherwise, I followed it exactly. I used canned chicken for the convenience and the whole thing might have taken me 15 minutes to put together. I'm going to make it again ASAP and definitely double batch it. It's my new lunch go to!

About 2 years ago, I made this up using avocados instead of greek yogurt. I think this one will be great too and will try it. I use avocado, roasted chicken breasts, dijon mustard, salt and pepper along with walnuts and raisins. diced onion and sometimes I add fresh spinach if I have it.

I have only ever made chicken salad with mayo, but this was absolutely delicious, and yes---it's even better when it's been refridgerated overnight. It is surprisingly rich, so I found that eating it with Wheat Thins made it seem less heavy. A keeper for sure!
I also added sweet pepper relish, which I like in my chicken salad. If the texture isn’t right, why night try adding a little light sour cream?
Using Fage Greek Yogurt 0% adds no sugar, contrary to another's review. It was delicious. I did add a dash of lemon juice and a sprinkle of poultry seasoning and omitted the cottage cheese.
If going for healthy omit the Craisins. Use grapes instead for a clean and healthier salad.
I thought that it was pretty good.

I love this. I make it every time I buy a rotisserie chicken, so, weekly. Some of the reviewers had comments along the lines of "bland" so I add 20 grams of pepperoncini and 1/4 t coriander. My "salt and pepper to taste" is 1/2 t salt and 1/4 t pepper. Next time I am going to try lime flavored yogurt for a little variety.
I made adjustment by doubling the diced chicken. The original recipe was too "saucy" -- and I let it marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours to soak up the flavors.

I added more onion and apples than called for, but it came out amazing. The taste is great. I used Dannon Greek yogurt vanilla light and 4% cottage cheese. So I did a little modification, but the salad tastes amazing!!!
Love it

I used roasted, unsalted cashews, as I did not have pecans in the pantry. It was an excellent substitution, actually. I seasoned the chicken breasts with pepper, powdered onion and powdered garlic and I left sit in the refrigerator overnight and then boiled in chicken broth. Also, I used lemon juice to avoid apple oxidation.The salad came out absolutely delicious.

I made this exactly how it was written. I think there was a little too much cottage cheese as it didn’t blend in as much as mayo would. I Love cranberries but I didn’t think they added that much taste but different texture. I added a few grapes on the side to see f it made a difference and it tasted fresher and lighter. Next time , I’d either add more apples or some grapes . Overall it tasted great was a nice change for a healthy summer chicken salad .
Very good

What a great way to reduce the fat content, increase protein and pack with greater flavor. I used thinly sliced chicken breasts, lightly coated with seafood seasoning and cooked in a skilled until browned. Everything was chopped to be the same size. It needed additional salt and was best moderately chilled. Great recipe!

I had a little of this and that leftover, and who can afford to throw leftovers out in our current economic climate. I found this recipe to be very forgiving. I had one grilled chicken breast leftover, enough for two generous servings, which I cut up. I didn't have any yogurt, so I used a cup of leftover cottage cheese, mixed with a tbsp of mayonnaise and a tbsp of sour cream. I added a tbsp of chopped red pepper, 2 tbsp chopped red onion, used walnuts instead of pecans, seasoned it with about 1/2 tsp of Greek seasoning and a bit of ground black pepper. I did have the rest of the recipe ingredients (apples, celery, craisins, Dijon mustard), and added those. Served it on top of thick slices of red native tomatoes, with a sliced cucumber salad and fresh watermelon. Came out pretty tasty, if I do say so myself.
Kath - I think what the video says is ONE 6 oz container. But they used the number 1 instead of the word, so it looks like 16 oz.
Very good. But I had to laugh at the video showing the chicken salad being served on a croissant. All that effort for a healthy salad! Ha!

I’ve been using Greek yogurt in cold salads for years, sometimes with a bit of mayo. Ricotta cheese is also an excellent substitute. Several readers comment on this recipe’s blandness. One way to pep it up is to add jalapeño mustard, a delicious and versatile addition I discovered a few years ago. I haven’t seen it in stores near me but it’s available online. Yummy!

Was very happy about how this recipe turned out. I didn't have quite enough yogurt on hand so used just a bit of light mayo and added a few fresh red grapes for a tad of sweetness. Delish! Will definitely keep this in my recipe book!

If you are looking to make this “healthy”, I would omit making it into a sandwich or at least use a different bread product in place of a croissant (higher in fat). I realize the nuts and Crasins are added for texture and flavor appeal . . . Just don’t over do it with these items from a caloric standpoint. And for those of you who thought it needed more flavor consider adding a small amount of lemon juice or apple cider vinegar to add some spark. And maybe a little garlic powder.

I'm not a fan of Greek yogurt so I was sceptical.. I was not impressed with the outcome. I put it in the refrigerator over night and OMG! The flavors came together so well. I will make it again but a day earlier than when I plan to serve it.
I loved this recipe... fast and tasty. I didn't have cottage cheese, but it didn't seem to matter.
SO GOOD! I was surprised how good this was. I will definitely be making this again. I used canned shredded chicken instead of the cubed

I used leftover grilled chicken both breasts and thighs and didn't use cottage cheese as it was a "leftovers" meal. And cashews not pecans. It was a big hit and a finicky niece had 2nds and finished the last of it the following morning and my sister has since asked for the recipe. My daughter gave it a 4 out of 10 ????.
Just made it. Tasted good!

We used canned chicken breast we had leftover (Keystone Brand). We loved this recipe and how the flavors which can be tweaked based on taste. The dijon mustard gave it tang, the greek yogurt was creamy and the cottage cheese was a good addition. The crunch of the onion, celery, pecans and chew of the cran-raisins created a mouthful of texture and flavors to please. We ate it on toast but have plans to eat it on crackers or a bed of lettuce another day. We made half the recipe which was super easy to adjust too. This is a new "go to" recipe for us.

It was terrific. I would suggest not feeling constrained with respect to some of the ingredients. I added more onion, apple, cranberries, pecans and Dijon than was suggested. You could probably put grapes in as well. It was the best chicken salad than I have ever had.
excellent!!

I liked the tarter taste of this chicken salad. It seems healthier and is a nice change of pace for chicken salad. My husband said he prefers a Mayo chicken salad but he had two helpings of this one, so I guess he liked it.
I was a little skeptical but I really loved this salad. I plan on making it again. Yum
Really good! But the Greek yogurt you get is THE MOST IMPORTANT. Some are super tangy and thin. FAGE' is essential! Great Value (though good for some things) will ruin the taste.

This was so easy and really good. I’m vegetarian but the rest of the family isn’t. I added the chicken last and so I was able to serve myself a portion without the chicken. The family loved it and so did I. So refreshing. Thank you
A little bland, but garnished it with tomatoes and feta and it was awesome!
A Great salad. I add more mustard and cheese chunks to it mine and it was perfect.
Fantastic substitute for mayo. Delicious salad full of fruits and savories.

For a different chicken salad this is very good, though I admit to some changes. Didn't have ANY kind of sugar-less yogurt so I substituted sour cream; no craisins so used raisins. I added a little bit of red bell pepper, didn't have any celery... and to moisten it up, I added a little orange juice with a little bit of zest. Definitely was winging it, but it went over very well with my picky husband!!
My wife and I loved it. We will definitely use this often.
Made it according to the recipe, love it!
Made it with Ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese, and it was a big hit at a potluck picnic.
Was nice however i added a bit of salt, black pepper , sugar and a dash of lemon juice for that extra zing
Absolutely loved it, thanks for the recipe. I'm going to make it like this from now on.
It was good. Change from the usual chicken salad. Thanks for introducing it so I could try it .
Healthy, delicious salad that all four of us loved. Refreshing and very flavorful.
I made it by the recipe. My husband and I both liked it and I will make it again. So glad not to use mayo.

I added shredded cheddar. Only made two serving size. The cottage cheese was an awful choice. The taste was not at all there for me. I’ll stick with mayo. 
Cottage cheese is a no go.

I loved it, and thank you to those who posted changes. I modified it as well. I like cottage cheese, but based on prior posts, I used ricotta instead, and I added the jalapeno crunchies as wel. I am now on day 3 of making this. Thank you. I love this recipe.
Tastes good but the texture is not my preference
I totally disliked it. Texture was probably the most offensive, maybe the yogurt and cottage cheese should be put through a blender for a smoother consistent taste. I also thought it lacked flavor.

Yogurt and cottage cheese...who would have thought! It was tasty. Kids liked it, but I also kept our own spin on chicken salad sandwiches, by adding a diced granny smith, candied pecans, a halved red grapes! Similar to Arbys! We are glad to skip the mayo anytime.

I was very skeptical about the replacement of mayonnaise but OMG!! Amazing. I just sort of eyeballed it so it wasn’t exact but I think it’s a personal preference on texture. The flavor was great! I am on a high-protein diet so this was perfect.
Tasty.
It didn’t have much flavor so am thinking of adding maybe some dried jalapeños to spice it up.
